meanings.definition: Placed at a high or powerful level
meanings.sent1: The exalted mountain peak touched the sky.
meanings.sent2: The queen received an exalted title for her noble deeds.
meanings.sent3: The exalted cake towered over the other desserts at the party.
meanings.sent4: His exalted position in the company made him a key decision-maker.
meanings.sent5: The exalted eagle soared majestically above the forest.

meanings.sent1: The exalted hero was celebrated by the entire town.
meanings.sent2: Her exalted performance in the play earned her a standing ovation.
meanings.sent3: The exalted puppy wagged its tail proudly after learning a new trick.
meanings.sent4: Their exalted dedication to charity work inspired others to join in.
meanings.sent5: The exalted artist's masterpiece was displayed in the museum.

meanings.sent1: The exalted general led his troops to victory.
meanings.sent2: She reached an exalted position within the royal court.
meanings.sent3: The exalted squirrel claimed the highest branch as its territory.
meanings.sent4: His exalted reputation as a scholar opened many doors for him.
meanings.sent5: The exalted sun cast a warm glow over the peaceful meadow.
